bioghist.p: The Witherspoon Society was organized in 1973 to work for renewal of the church's life and focus, so that it may continue to be biblically and confessionally faithful in the world. The society's goals are to implement the mission priorities of the General Assembly, develop vehicles of communication, reflection, mutual support, and disciplined action within the network, identify emerging priorities in the church and the world, encourage theological inquiry, seek more effective institutional forms, and seek effective ecumenical expressions of mission.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Witherspoon Society of Presbyterians. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence related to meetings, the publication of Network News (newsletter), membership, and the Society's work on various programs; financial information, including expense reports, financial statements, and budgets; conference materials, including programs and participant lists; proposals for programs and requests for the Society to address social issues; issues of a newsletter titled The Commissioner Memo, 1978; and member lists and membership directories. The collection also includes minutes of the steering committee and executive committee, annual meeting minutes, by-laws, and reports, 1976-1979. Many of the papers appear to have come from the files of Andrew and Dorothea Murray, and Elaine Wareham.
